Author: Strob#3417
Content:
I am finally getting my inbound p2p connections
```css
-CHAIN-     -NOTR- -LASTN- -UTXO-    -BAL-   -BLOX- -LASTB- -CON- -SIZE-
KMD[U]               2h31m     47    2.867  1296770     46s    17   2.0M 0 mined
BEER             4      5h     36    2.972    78851     32s    17   860K       
PIZZA            6   2h31m     18    2.302    71066     37s    16   820K All:10
TXSCLCC          8      5h     36    2.996   181583      3m    22   184K @ 03:36
```
Spent all night on this, I just had to remove my router cause my new modem supplied by my isp was not set as a bridge like I thought but was acting as a second router blocking incoming connection even though I opened the ports on it and on my personnal router. At one point I was out of internet and not able to connect to the modem interface, by luck I have 24h support so my isp could reset their modem and I could fix all my problems!!! So now I'm back!

Author: Strob#3417
Content: @smk762 -  dracocanis ominator  I use the decker autosplit and it was working flawlessly on my previous server but since I switch to another server with nvme drives, the script doesn't recognize my utxo and split too much. When I run it manually it works, but it fail in a cron job.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: I might just set my alarm to go off every 20 minutes for the next couple of weeks, setup a hotkey macro and put my laptop on the bedside table.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: You need to make sure there is only 1 utxo that you can split

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: if there is 2 utxo that it can split it can split mroe than once before the tx is confirmed

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
https://github.com/KMDLabs/StakedNotary/blob/master/dwy_attack_mitigation.sh#L8
This command will merge all utxos that are not uguana utxo onto a single one.

Author: Greer#0666
Content: you guys dont sleep.... I'm getting back to this after some needed sleep.  I'm using https://github.com/Alrighttt/2019NNtestnet instead of https://github.com/jl777/SuperNET for testnet per recommendation last night.  Documentation a little unclear to me.  `Edit the iguana/m_notary_testnet file. Add a line with your IP address.` is easy, in fact is not needed because is set automatically then `Edit the iguana/testnet.json file. Add your pubkey and name.` Which pubkey?  Wallet on the node or pubkey for the address used for votes or other?

Author: PHBA2061#2530
Content: your `btcpubkey` if I'm not mistaken

Author: Strob#3417
Content: yes look here search for btcpubkey https://docs.komodoplatform.com/notary/setup-Komodo-Notary-Node.html#setting-up-supernet-iguana

Author: Strob#3417
Content: ```Create an iguana wallet with encryptwallet and importprivkey into both komodod and bitcoind using the KMDwif and BTCwif in the encryptwallet```

Author: Strob#3417
Content: the goal is to have all your assets addresses having the same pubkey

Author: Strob#3417
Content: you will import the private  key in each wallet

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: BTC or KMD pubkey for testnet though?

Author: Strob#3417
Content: the KMD private key

Author: Strob#3417
Content: it will be the same for all

Author: Strob#3417
Content: the KMD private is called BTCDwif

Author: Strob#3417
Content: The important step is this command where you get your pubkey (called btcpubkey and not pubkey!!!) and the KMDwif called BTCDwif. A bit confusing but that's the way it is. ```curl --url "http://127.0.0.1:7778" --data "{\"agent\":\"bitcoinrpc\",\"method\":\"encryptwallet\",\"passphrase\":\"insert very secure password here\"}"```

Author: Greer#0666
Content: I'm right in that 2019NNtestnet replaces SuperNET?

Author: Strob#3417
Content: yes

Author: Strob#3417
Content: But if you want to understand the whole process I think it's better to follow the instructions above and then you follow the testnet instructions
